transcripts.text: I guess I'm one of these people that likes running.  It's always really kept me on the straight and narrow.

In October 2018, former British Royal Marine Chris Thall set out to run 999 miles across the United Kingdom to support the Bhutan charity and raise awareness of issues surrounding veteran mental health and veteran suicide.
One day I was sat at the computer and I thought, Has anyone ever run the length of the UK?

Hello, friend.  I just want to talk to you a little bit about my Patreon membership, Team Thrall.  If you've watched one of my videos or you've read one of my books, perhaps you'd be kind enough to consider joining me on Patreon.  just paying a token amount, $2.50 a month.  That's less than two pounds in English currency.  And you'll really be helping me to build my YouTube channel, to spread a positive message about how to get your goals, how to keep good fitness, how to eat a good diet, And just a lot of small hacks that I use to keep myself not just happy, but focused, enlightened, seeing through all the bullshit in life and really, really getting what I want out of it.  It's really important at this time in our crazy world where everybody just wants to make off you.  They just want to control you.  They want to sell you stuff through advertising.  They want to tell you what kind of person you are.  They want to control your mind.  They want to control your spending.  They want to control your internet use.  And I'm just here to help you see through all that because you don't want to get to the end of your life and realize you didn't achieve all your goals like I have.  So for £2.50 a month, you're going to get the inside information on what's going on in my life, my writing, my career, my adventure challenges.  As you know, I ran 1,000 miles nonstop for charity.  You're gonna get video advice on how to achieve your goals.  You'll get a free electronic copy of my latest book, And obviously you'll get a thank you from me.  I promise you, I will be able to add far more than a small £2 fee ever will.  If you're watching this on Patreon, you're already there.  If you're not, it's patreon.com.  forward slash Chris Thrall.  Just my name, C-H-R-I-S.  T-H-R-A-L-L.  If you'd like to make a one-off payment, you can just do that through paypal.me.  forward slash team thrall.  T-H-R-A-L-L.  Hasn't changed.  So thank you for listening and let's go forward together.

I thought, you know what, I'd really, really like to do that.  Not just for the run.  In fact, the run was probably the least part of it.  I was more interested in setting myself such a challenge, spending time on my own and camping in a sort of an idyllic spot every night, or at least that was the plan.  So I thought, yeah, I'll run the length of the UK.  So I decided I'm going to run solo, as in just myself.  I'm going to be unsupported, as in I'm not going to have a crew with me.  I'm going to carry all my own equipment so I can camp as and when I need to.  And I'm going to run an ultramarathon today.  And just as I decided to do that, and just as I started to get my equipment together, I popped a disc in my spine.  and it was next to kidney stones.  It was the most painful thing I'd ever experienced.  I phoned my surgeon and I just begged him, is there any way you can kill this last bit of pain?  He gave me a swift operation.  I still had significant back pain.  I had brain damage from all the medication that I'd had to take when I was in extreme pain.  I put them to my partner and said, you know, should I really be doing this?  And she said, Chris, you'll do it, and that was it.  To see her belief in me at a time where I wasn't even sure myself, that just told me, yeah, I will, won't I?  I'll do it.  A big part of it was I wanted to show people what the human body and the human mind's capable of, how if you set your goals, you should just follow them through and not let anything or anybody deter you.  There hasn't been a single footstep I've taken on this journey.  that hasn't been thoroughly enjoyable.  I'm going to do it for a veterans charity.  I want to raise awareness of this alarming rate of suicide we've got amongst our veterans at the moment.  If I have to crawl an ultramarathon a day, that's what I will do.  I wanted to put the message out there to veterans who are struggling as I had, that there's always a light.  So long as you look within, you dig deep, Change maybe a few of your paradigms.  Be prepared to change.  You can achieve anything.
